stream_context.summary: Kaze live-reviews and integrates Biobak’s full visual/structural overhaul of Course 11 “Oily Boily Bay,” fixes export/material issues in Blender/Fast64, and discusses releasing a new Course 1-only demo to gather physics and camera feedback.

development_findings.summary: Kaze plans a public "Course 1–only" demo, bundled with a Google form, to harvest large-scale feedback on the new physics and camera.
development_findings.quote: I'm thinking what we should do is make another demo with just course one and then we use that to get feedback on the physics and the camera.

development_findings.summary: Biobak delivered a near-complete rebuild of Course 11 that is more vibrant, brutalist in style, and actually has ~1,700 fewer triangles despite the added detail.
development_findings.quote: This tower looks so cool… This is an awesome remake already.

development_findings.summary: Kaze must redo the collision map and address a crash because the new geometry no longer matches the old collision data.
New mechanic: holding A while stomping a Goomba now gives a higher bounce and mid-air control, mimicking 2D Mario timing.
development_findings.quote: If you hold the A button… you jump higher and you regain some control of Mario.

development_findings.summary: Several technical fixes queued: swap transparent decal layers (6 ↔ 5), restore two-cycle fog on materials, recreate missing Blender user-presets, mark oily light to affect Mario only when above it, and stop updating the safe-position when Mario is hanging on ledges.

Visual polish tasks noted: add spark particles on the power generator, dynamic oil lighting, elevator doors synced to cabin with custom camera & music, light shafts over boss arena, mild pulsing factory lights.
Kaze is dissatisfied with the current Freezie enemy model and plans a rework with darker eyes and hand-drawn textures.

context_findings.summary: Kaze rejects traditional colour-theory rules, insisting on emotion-driven palettes and rational iteration rather than "complementary wheel" dogma.
context_findings.quote: The point of what you're making is not to just pick random colours; the point is to evoke an emotion.

context_findings.summary: He openly prefers autocratic decision-making over democratic design processes, seeing humility as a ‘coward’s tactic’.
context_findings.quote: I genuinely believe me making every single decision ever is better than democracy for everyone involved, especially me.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values empirical player data: multiple remarks about needing large-scale play-testing before finalising physics and camera.
He compares his solo timeline favourably to Nintendo’s, noting Odyssey’s five-year dev span to defend the hack’s long schedule.

biobak.summary: Supplied complete "Oily Boily Bay" remake with exhaustive changelog: new containers, cranes, brutalist Bowser tower, colour-coded walkways, re-textured factory, underwater section, boss arena, and ~1,700 triangle reduction.
biobak.quote: Updated Bowser Tower based on sexy brutalist architecture… it's only 4,400 triangles.

biobak.summary: Provided asset guidelines: eleven hydraulic variants for vertex-colour lighting, hamster-wheel Koopa easter egg, elevator mesh with door gaps, multi-directional oil scrolls, and requests for spark particles and light flicker.

key_stories.title: Oily Boily Bay Reinvented
key_stories.summary: The level once looked "poopy" and ran poorly. Biobak rebuilt it from scratch; Kaze live-tested, caught export bugs, and assigned collision, lighting, and camera tasks.
key_stories.challenge: Original visuals and performance were sub-par.
key_stories.process: Biobak remodelled; Kaze inspected Blender files, fixed materials, and planned engine tweaks.
key_stories.outcome: Level is brighter, stylistically coherent, and lighter to render; final polish steps logged.
key_stories.key_quote: Holy shit, this is so vibrant… This is an awesome remake already.

key_stories.title: Targeted Demo for Physics Feedback
key_stories.summary: To perfect Mario’s feel, Kaze will strip the game to Course 1, release it publicly, and collect structured feedback.
key_stories.challenge: Need quantitative data on new physics and camera.
key_stories.process: Plan demo + Google form, focus on varied Course 1 elements (slides, poles, open spaces).
key_stories.outcome: Timeline implied within weeks; will precede wider demo.
key_stories.key_quote: Make another demo with just course one and then get feedback on the physics and the camera.

key_stories.title: High-Bounce Goomba Mechanic
key_stories.summary: Kaze adds a feature where holding A on a stomp gives a higher rebound, adding depth to movement.
key_stories.challenge: Make movement ‘more fun’ and reminiscent of 2D games.
key_stories.outcome: Movement chain feels smoother; slated for demo test.
key_stories.key_quote: You can jump on Goombas normally, but if you hold A you jump higher.

key_stories.title: Kaze’s Colour-Theory Rebellion
key_stories.summary: Kaze vents about mainstream colour-theory charts, favouring mood-first design.
key_stories.challenge: Reconciling art guidance with personal philosophy.
key_stories.process: Rant contrasts ‘emotion tools’ versus preset palettes.
key_stories.outcome: Sets design tone for team; reveals creative values.
key_stories.key_quote: It’s not about complementary wheels; it’s about evoking the feeling you want.

open_questions.context: Idea to add custom camera and ‘elevator music’ while inside lifts.
